Halifax recorded a hard-fought 2-0 victory over Goodricke in the long-awaited first weekend of college football this term.

In a meeting of two of the smaller teams of the college rugby scene, a clinical Halifax team scored five tries on their way to beating a depleted Vanbrugh side in this play-off.

Alcuin took the spoils against Langwith with a 6-0 win, thanks to a sensational second half performance and a hat-trick from man of the match, Alex Brown.

James hit the ground running as college football made its long anticipated return, smashing five without reply past a helpless Vanbrugh side.

The men's football seconds earned a well deserved victory against their Teesside opponents, outplaying them in every department and playing some superb football in the process.

Late goals deny York first win

Sheffield struck twice late on to record a thrilling 3-2 victory over the men's football firsts, denying them their first league win of the season.

Women footballers prevail in eleven-goal thriller

York's women's footballers' survived a late scare from their Sheffield counterparts to achieve their first league win of the season in a game dominated by attacking intent.

Women's badminton annihilate Northumbria

Only three points separate these teams in their closely fought BUCS league, but any spectator present in the Sports Hall today could be forgiven for thinking the gap was much larger.

Stunning start gives men's hockey firsts victory

A sparkling first half performance helped the men's firsts to only their second league win of the season, as they beat Northumbria 6-2.

Both Derwent and James produced good performances to see off their rivals in Sunday's college netball.

The men's waterpolo firts braved the conditions on Saturday and travelled to Liverpool for their remaining BUCS fixtures.
